intro: Draba elegans, commonly known as the elegant whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. It has basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate, and its flowering period occurs in early spring. Draba elegans is known for its hardy nature and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value.
